name: Stack Auth
headline: The open-source Auth0 alternative
description:
Stack is the open-source authN, authZ, and user management platform.

We build for devs who want to iterate quickly, offering both managed auth and self-hosting. You can set it up in one minute and scale with the project as it grows.

Stack was built by repeat founders with strong technical backgrounds. Check out our GitHub: https://github.com/stack-auth/stack

founders.name: Konstantin Wohlwend, Founder
founders.description:
I build user authentication @ Stack.

If you're building a modern web app with user logins, we should chat!

https://n2d4.github.io 👋

founders.name: Zai Shi, Founder
founders.description: Building the best user login/management experience for developers, 100% open-source!

generated_description:
**Stack Auth: An Open-Source Alternative for Developers**

Founded in 2024 and part of Y Combinator's Batch S24, Stack Auth is revolutionizing the world of authentication and user management. It's essentially an open-source alternative to Auth0, designed specifically for developers who need speed and flexibility in their projects.

### Mission and Vision
Stack Auth encapsulates the idea of building a platform that enhances the way developers manage authentication (authN) and authorization (authZ). The goal? To empower developers with tools that allow them to iterate quickly, whether they prefer managed solutions or self-hosting. At Stack Auth, you can have your user management system set up in just a minute, making it a perfect fit for fast-growing projects.

### What They Offer
- **Ease of Use:** With an emphasis on simplicity, you can install and integrate Stack Auth into any Next.js project without fuss.
- **Managed and Self-Hosted Options:** Developers can choose how they'd like to deploy, whether in-house or using Stack Auth's hosting services.
- **Developer-Centric Features:** They offer support for standards like JWT, SSO, and 2FA, along with robust user management capabilities—all within a developer-friendly interface.

### Robust Functionality
Stack Auth not only manages authentication but also offers seamless integrations for organizations and teams, permissions management, and even webhooks for syncing with tools like Slack and databases. It caters to a variety of user needs with features that are both intuitive and powerful.

### Comparative Advantage
What sets Stack Auth apart from its competitors? It's the combination of being fully open-source, developer-focused, and offering reasonable pricing. Stack Auth appeals to the developer community looking for transparency and control over their authentication systems. It's built for those who want to own their auth solutions rather than being tied to enterprise-level options.

### Community and Growth
Being an open-source project, organic growth is vital for Stack Auth. The feedback from users speaks volumes—developers have reported rapid implementations and high satisfaction thanks to the responsive support team. You can check out their [GitHub](https://github.com/stack-auth/stack) for contributions and to become a part of the community.

### Pricing
They have a straightforward pricing model:
- **Free:** For individuals wanting to self-host.
- **Team Plan:** $49/month for small teams.
- **Growth Plan:** $299/month for larger enterprises needing scalability.

### Conclusion
In a nutshell, Stack Auth is positioning itself as a vital tool for developers looking to simplify their authentication needs without sacrificing control or flexibility. It’s about building with confidence, and if you're in the tech community, it’s worth checking out. To learn more or to get started, visit their [website](https://stack-auth.com). 

This isn’t just about identity management; it’s about empowering developers to take charge of their tech stack. If you’re tired of the cumbersome setups of traditional authentication services, Stack Auth might just be what you’re looking for.
